description: A study by the French Institute of International Relations (IFRI) examines the war in Ukraine's socio-economic impact, from the jobs created by the military-industrial complex to salaries and bonuses distributed to soldiers.

headline: Limiting global warming to 1.5°C is now impossible
description: According to a group of scientists, the target set by the 2015 Paris Agreement can no longer be met due to the inability of countries to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

headline: Free the knees! A plea for shorts at the office
description: While no law prohibits it, wearing shorts to work is often enough to have you pegged as a professional slacker. Could this laid-back dress code actually be a form of environmental avant-gardism instead? Le Monde's Nicolas Santolaria explores the question in his column.

headline: At the heart of the Arctic, the 'Noah's Ark for plants' welcomes new seeds
description: Since 2008, 1.3 million seed varieties from 128 countries have been deposited in the global seed vault, located in Norway's Svalbard archipelago. It serves as a life insurance policy in case of disaster.

description: After a turbulent 2023 marked by the consequences of the terrorist attacks by Hamas, French people's acceptance of others again increased in 2024, according to the National Consultative Commission on Human Rights' annual study. But prejudice persists.

headline: Why Paris's Centre Pompidou, not even 50 years old, must close for five years
description: The building designed by Renzo Piano and Richard Rogers is set to undergo major renovations until 2030 in order to reduce its energy consumption by 40%. Since its opening in 1977, the space has been in constant transformation.

headline: The 2021 US withdrawal from Afghanistan, a solo decision
description: 'The Transatlantic Divorce' (4/5). Initiated by Donald Trump in 2020 without consulting US allies, the American departure from Kabul unfolded the following year in apocalyptic conditions as the Taliban retook control of the country, wiping out the effects of two decades of Western intervention.
